item.title: Immigration Pathways to move to Canada as a Mechanic or Auto Technician
item.dc:creator: Alka bisht
item.description: The post Immigration Pathways to move to Canada as a Mechanic or Auto Technician appeared first on AMK Global Group.
item.content:encoded:
Are you an experienced Mechanic or Automobile Technician and want to pursue your career dreams in your dream country?

If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you! 

Immigrants to Canada as Mechanics and Auto Technicians are considered highly skilled professionals, making them eligible for numerous government migration programs like the Provincial Nominee Programs and Express Entry.

With over 70 different immigration programmes and visas available for skilled and semi-skilled workers, you have a higher chance of setting up a new life in the country with your loved ones as a Mechanic or an Automobile Technician. 

However, with so many options accessible, the process may be somewhat complex, particularly when trying to figure out which programmes are best for you and will improve the chances that your visa application will be approved.

So, do not worry. This blog has made it easier to choose the best immigration pathways to move to Canada. So, stay tuned till the end.

Eligibility Criteria for immigrating to Canada as a Mechanic

  • To Immigrate to Canada as a Mechanic or an  Auto Technician, you must fulfill the language proficiency standards for each language. So let’s have a look at that.
    • Writing – Minimum 4 bands according to the FSW program through Express Entry.
    • Reading – Minimum 3.5 bands according to the FSW program through Express Entry.
    • Listening – Minimum 5 bands according to the FSW program through Express Entry.
    • Speaking – Minimum 5 bands according to the FSW program through Express Entry.
  • Within five years before enrolling, you must have at least two years of full-time job experience as a Mechanic or Automobile Technician in a skilled trade.
  • Your employment experience must have been for a wage (paid salaries or earned commission; unpaid internships or voluntary labour do not count).
  • Meet the National Occupational Classification’s requirements for that skilled occupation, except needing a certificate of competence.
  • Have a genuine job offer for a minimum of one year or a provincial or federal body in the country-issued certificate of qualification in that specialized trade.

To check your eligibility or to get the best Canada immigration process for Mechanics, get a free consultation from our experienced & regulated professionals.

BOOK NOW

If you have the specified minimal qualifications, you must have prior experience performing most of the following tasks

  • Review work orders and talk with the supervisor about the work.
  • Use computerized diagnostic and other testing tools to inspect the motor while running, road test the car, and test automotive systems and components to identify and resolve issues.
  • Adjust, repair, or replace vehicle systems parts and components with hand tools and other specialized automotive repair tools. These include fuel, brakes, steering, suspension, engine, drivetrain, emissions control, cooling and climate control, and electrical and electronic systems.
  • Perform regular maintenance, including oil changes, lubrications, and tune-ups.
  • Inform customers about the service, the vehicle’s general condition and upcoming maintenance needs.

Want to know more about the Canadian immigration process for Mechanics and Auto technicians? Get in touch with us for the appropriate knowledge from the best Canada Immigration Consultant

BOOK NOW

Pathways to immigrate to Canada as a Mechanic or Auto Technician

As Mechanics and Auto Technicians jobs are high in Canada, there are some ways to immigrate to Canada as a Mechanic or Auto Technician.

Express Entry

The Express Entry system is designed to assist talented workers who want to work in the country by managing Canada’s three federal economic immigration programmes. In addition, the CRS (Comprehensive Ranking System) is a point-based system that considers your age, abilities, education, and work experience.

After creating an online Express Entry profile, you will be included in a draw pool that occurs every day. You will be considered in a draw pool held every two weeks once you have created an online Express Entry profile. The top applicants will then be chosen to obtain an ITA (Invitation to Apply) for Canadian permanent residence.

Program for Federal Skilled Trades

You can immigrate to Canada as a Mechanic or Auto Technician under the Federal Skilled Trades Program, which is run by the Express Entry platform. Major Group 73 comprises all maintenance and equipment operating trades and includes Mechanics.

To qualify for this program, you must meet the following requirements:

  • Possess certification of qualification issued by a provincial agency OR a valid job offer from a Canadian company for at least one year.
  • Possess an acceptable Canadian Language Benchmark score for French and English (level 4 for writing + reading and level 5 for listening + speaking).
  • Before applying, have at least two years of job experience; and
  • Possess the capacity to prove your expertise and abilities in your field.

Provincial Nominee Program

Suppose you are qualified and have a legitimate job offer in demand in a particular province or territory. In that case, you may be eligible to work in the country under the Provincial Nominee Program. Each province or territory has a unique PNP created to address that region’s labour market demands. Therefore, while Mechanics and Auto technicians might be in need in Alberta, Saskatchewan, or Manitoba, they might not be in Ontario. It is crucial because the lists of the most in-demand professions are constantly changing.

If your application is accepted, you will obtain a province nomination worth 600 CRS points, which will almost certainly result in an ITA for Canadian permanent residence.

To identify the best fit for you, your dedicated regulated advisor at AMK Global Group will get to know your needs, aspiration, and hopes for Canada

BOOK NOW

Canada offers multiple opportunities to aspirants who want to work in Canada. At AMK Global Jobs Boards, we have added some exciting job opportunities like Auto Detailers, Car Mechanics,  Auto technicians, and Petrol / Diesel Mechanics to those who want to work in the country and excel in their career as Mechanics.

We are accepting requests from foreign nationals desiring to live and work in Canada on an accelerated basis for immediate full-time employment in this profession. 

If you want to work as a Mechanic or Auto Technician in your dream country, CA, we want to hear from you!!

Send us your resume at info@amk.global and start your immigration journey with us TODAY.

Get the most accessible pathways to immigrate to Canada as a Mechanicand Auto technician – BOOK your FREE assessment NOW.

To identify the best fit for you, your dedicated regulated advisor at AMK Global Group will get to know your needs, aspiration, and hopes for Canada

BOOK NOW

Are there any certification requirements for the Mechanic & Automobile Technician?

Each province and territory establishes its requirements for certification. It is possible to become certified as an automotive service technician in British Columbia, Saskatchewan, Manitoba, Newfoundland and Labrador, the Yukon, the Northwest Territories, and Nunavut, but it is not legally needed. You do not need to complete an apprenticeship and obtain a Certificate of Qualification (or comparable certification).

Without attending school, becoming a Mechanic is not possible in other provinces. This is because the automotive industry is a required trade in certain regions, emphasizing that you need a license to be a Mechanic.

What is the Red Seal test?

The Red Seal Exam is a test that evaluates your understanding of trade and commerce. Each province and territory use it to grant a Red Seal endorsement. In most cases section, organizations qualify tradespeople using the Red Seal Test. It resembles the “final test” in many ways for skilled workers.

Each question is multiple-choice, with the same significance. The four possible answers have only one correct answer and three incorrect answers.

Red SealTest Format Highlights

  •  Per test, 100 to 150 questions.
  •  Exam time is limited to four hours.
  •  Questions with Many Options (equal points).
  •  One question provides four alternative options (A, B, C, or D).
  •  The cutoff is 70%.

Factors for Red Seal Canada Eligibility

Most probably, many individuals want to know if the red seal programme is limited to residents of Canada or if individuals in countries can also make use of it.

 However, suppose you are a skilled worker who received your training outside Canada. In that case, you must possess the necessary credentials and work experience to qualify for the red seal test.

 Some immigration specialists claim that you need to meet specific requirements, including;

  •  Competitor or Trade Qualification (experienced trade workers),
  •  Apprentice (completing an apprenticeship programme in Canada) (completing an apprenticeship programme in Canada),
  •  Journeyperson (not yet certified as Journeyman in Canada),
  •  4-6 years of professional experience.
  •  A significant trade certificate
  •  Diploma proof.

Importantly, self-employed skilled workers can obtain trade certification by demonstrating their qualifications if they are qualified tradesperson who resides anywhere other than Canada, such as India, the Philippines, Pakistan, China, etc. Then, you must submit an application for the Red Seal test as a challenger or trade qualification.

If you want to know more about the training requirements that regulate auto Mechanics, you can contact us at info@amk.global 

Benefits of working in Canada as a Mechanic or Auto Technician

While looking at the best immigration pathways to immigrate to Canada, you must enjoy the advantages of working there.

Future employment possibilities

Automobiles will probably continue to be a standard mode of transportation. As a result, there will likely always be a demand for skilled Mechanics. In addition, since this business is less likely than others to lose jobs to automation or outsourcing, auto Mechanics often have long-term career possibilities.

Various chances are available.

Auto Mechanics can work full-time for an auto repair shop or on their own, either by starting their own business or visiting the customers’ homes or offices. An Auto Mechanic may also combine the preceding two jobs, working part-time at an auto shop and carrying out freelance auto repair work.

General Contentment and Job Satisfaction

According to the World Happiness Report, you may anticipate working in a nation ranked in the top 20 for total happiness based on data from 2020 when you live and work in the country.

Furthermore, nearly 90% of Canadians say they are content at work, demonstrating how happy Canadian workers are.

Nationality in Canada

You might have higher chances and more advantages when applying for citizenship in the country if you’ve started working and establishing yourself as a permanent resident.

A person must have been a permanent resident of the country for at least 1,095 days, or three years, in the previous five years to be eligible to apply for citizenship. More than 85% of long-term residents have obtained Canadian citizenship.

Read More About- 7 Reasons- That will make you want to work in Canada.

How Can AMK Global Group Assist You in immigrating to Canada as a Mechanic or Auto Technician? 

With so many opportunities here, working in Canada could be the step forward you’ve been looking for. So book a FREE assessment from here- and make sure every step of the application process goes as quickly and successfully as possible to guarantee you get off to the most excellent possible start on your journey to Canada.

Visit our website for more information about the Work Permit process.

The post Immigration Pathways to move to Canada as a Mechanic or Auto Technician appeared first on AMK Global Group.

item.title: Find out everything you need to know about the IELTS exam for Canada.
item.dc:creator: Alka bisht
item.description: The post Find out everything you need to know about the IELTS exam for Canada. appeared first on AMK Global Group.
item.content:encoded:
Undoubtedly, Canadian cities are among the most attractive in the nation due to their friendly ethnic populations, pollution-free environment & delightful climate throughout the year. Its diverse options for studying, working & becoming a citizen has made Canada the most popular destination for individuals & family planning to settle abroad.

We are sure you may have thought about obtaining permanent residency in Canada if you want to study and work there, right?

However, to obtain specific visas, you must show documentation of your language proficiency in English or French, the two Official Languages of Canada, to ensure that you can communicate well. And for that, you must take the IELTS General Training test, the preferred test for immigration to Canada, to verify your English language skills.

So, before we dive deep into IELTS and its training, let’s first understand what IELTS exam for Canada is and its importance.

What is IELTS Exam??

To move, study, or work in a country where the dominant language is English, you must pass IELTS (International English Language Testing System).

Your ability to Read, Speak, and Write and Listen to English will be assessed during the test.

Additionally, IELTS scores are given on a scale from 1 to 9. You can provide IELTS on computer or paper, and it is the only high-stakes language exam accepted for immigration in Canada and some other countries.

How Important is the IELTS Test?

IELTS is the world’s most widely accepted English language test, trusted by the immigration authorities in Canada, Australia, New Zealand, and the UK. It is recognized by over 11,000 organizations worldwide.

The IELTS exam for Canada improves your English language skills.

It evaluates four language abilities: Listening, speaking, Writing, and Reading. In addition, through our regulated team of consultants, you can acquire various study strategies to improve your English language abilities.

Importance in real-world communication.

The speaking test involves live contact between you and the examiner, unlike other exams that use an automated speaking test. This assists in simulating real-world conversations, such as those you would have with neighbours and coworkers, better preparing you for life abroad.

The IELTS exam for Canada assists in achieving your life’s long-term objectives.

You can create clear goals and get more motivated to study by taking the exam. It’s simple to put off studying or wait until the last minute when you don’t have defined objectives and goals. Having clear objectives for the test will motivate you to explore every day and improve your English skills.

Taking the IELTS exam for Canada can increase your job prospects.

Excellent communication skills are essential in the modern world, as English is the primary language in 55 nations. If you demonstrate that you have a solid command of the language, you could be able to pursue a career overseas!

Many nations, including Canada, demand that you speak more advanced English. Instead, to work in these nations, you must prove that you are a “competent” language user by passing the test with a specific score.

Learn more about why Canada is the best place to work & study abroad for you.

Eligibility for IELTS exam for Canada

Anyone can take the exam regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, nationality, or religion; however, individuals under 16 should not.

Test Format for IELTS

IELTS has two aspects: 
  • Academic 
  • General Training. 

You can take Academic online at home or any private location with a reliable internet connection and on paper or a computer in a testing facility.

You can take identical Speaking and Listening tests for Academic and General Training but distinct Reading and Writing tests. So make sure you get ready for the right kind of test.

There are no gaps between the Listening, Reading, and Writing components of any IELTS exam; they are all finished on the same day.

However, arranging the Speaking test up to a week before or after the other exams is possible. Your Speaking test will typically happen before other tests if you schedule this exam online.

Want to know the eligibility of your IELTS scores for your Visa? Book a free assessment to speak with our regulated consultants

BOOK NOW

What is the IELTS exam Pattern?

Applicants who want to perform well on their tests should fully grasp the pattern and syllabus. The four components of the IELTS syllabus are Reading, Listening, Speaking, and Writing.

Along with receiving a grade on these four components, students also receive an overall score. Finally, the scores in the four skill areas are combined to create the final score.

How can I register for the IELTS exam to move to Canada?

Keep your passport close to your hand when registering because you will need to provide your passport number. On top of that, you must also bring your access to the test. Here are easy measures to take to register for the exam:

  • You must first go to the British Council’s official registration page.
  • Sign up for a British Council account.
  • Find the examination location that is most convenient for you.
  • Register and pay for the IELTS exam online.

NOTE: Candidate under 18 must have their parent or legal guardian schedule the exam on their behalf. Once you have registered for the exam, your test centre will email you a written confirmation mentioning the time and date of your exam.

How to prepare for the Canadian IELTS exam for your Work permit & PR?

We have put together a list of practical actions to help you get started because we know how intimidating and overwhelmed you may feel as you prepare for your test. Here are some tips to assist you with your exam.

Take a practice test.

Before studying, take a practice test to determine where you need improvement. This phase aims to help you evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of your initial planning. It’s crucial to build on your strengths and improve your areas of weakness to prepare well for the exam.

Recognize the exam’s time limits.

As you develop a better understanding of the test’s layout, your chances of passing it successfully within the allocated time rise.

To get used to the test’s pace, practise under controlled conditions.

Understand the test’s structure.

You must be familiar with the test structure before you begin to study. Review the test’s topic matter and each part’s question and task formats to prepare.

Listen to English while doing other things.

It is well known that the listening exam is complex, and the hearing component is no exception. You will be asked forty questions throughout four recordings. In addition, there will be one playthrough of each recording.

Build a broad range of reading abilities

The reading module’s sole function is to assess various reading abilities. Reading strategies include getting the gist, reading for primary concepts, reading for specifics, skimming, comprehending a logical argument, and identifying the author’s viewpoints, attitudes, and goals.

What is a suitable IELTS score for immigration to Canada?

The required IELTS score for your Visa depends on every application.

For example, if you are applying for a Study Permit in Canada, you have to score the minimum required score for the program you are applying for in that particular college/ university; typically, this would be an average of 6.5 for IELTS Academic. IELTS is not mandatory if you are applying for a Work Permit Visa; however, taking the exam always strengthens your application, which is always advisable. (Normally 5-6 bands in IELTS General) 

If you have working experience in hospitality, reach out to us at info@amk.global and get started on your immigration journey.

How long is the validity of my IELTS score?

IELTS score validity only lasts two years to preserve the information’s originality. In a given year, candidates can take the exam as often as they choose.

Students must prove their language proficiency to study, live, or work in English-speaking countries. Students can use the International English Language Testing System to aid their studies. In addition, students who intend to pursue further education overseas must be familiar with this test’s components, including test Validity.

IELTS is a requirement for Canadian PR.

IELTS is not strictly necessary to obtain Canadian PR. Think about it this way: For those applying for economic immigration, such as those who do so through Express Entry, passing a language test is just one step toward permanent residence in Canada.

What is the IELTS score required for Canadian PR?

The minimum IELTS requirement to apply for Canadian PR depends on the program you wish to submit your application (You can submit your application through Express Entry Program, where you have three subcategories, FSW, FST, CEC and PNP( Provincial Nominee Programs).

Suppose you are applying as a candidate for the Federal Skilled Worker program under the Express Entry Category. In that case, you must provide language test scores equivalent to or better than the Canadian Language Benchmark (CLB) 7 to come under for Entry into the Express Entry pool of candidates. For example, a CLB 7 is equivalent to an IELTS speaking, reading, writing, and listening score of 6.0.

You must score 6.0 to apply as a Canadian Experience Class candidate under Express Entry for NOC 0 or A levels. However, if your line of work falls under the NOC B skill level, you may be able to join the pool with a speaking, writing, and listening score of 5.0 and a reading score of 4.0.

Candidates for skilled federal trades may be qualified to join the pool if they receive scores of 4.0 in writing and speaking, 3.5 in reading, and 4.5 in listening, which equate to a CLB level 4. The result has been a new lowering of the bar.

Want to know more about Canadian PR? Contact us at info@amk.global or visit our page to learn more.

How important is the IELTS test to obtain a Work Permit in Canada?

Using Express Entry, anyone can easily immigrate to Canada. Talented immigrants who wish to live permanently in Canada and contribute to its growth are the target audience for this program. A strong IELTS score can significantly increase a candidate’s chances of being chosen for Express Canada entrance. However, candidates must also submit various other documents to support their Education, Experience and Age.

Although Work Permits do not require IELTS according to immigration requirements, it is clear that IELTS is still a requirement for submitting your PR application. Hence it’s always better to have your IELTS done prior and attach it to your Work Permit application for better results, in addition to the other requirements. Therefore, whether applying for a Work Permit or a PR, one should consider including their score because it would significantly improve their chances of getting accepted.

Is the IELTS Examination easy to pass? 

Yes, you do not need to worry about appearing for this examination. If your native language is not English, you can still study, learn & score decent marks in the IELTS examination for your Visa Approval. At AMK Global Group, we have witnessed many clients speaking non-English languages pass the IELTS Exam with good scores and now are also PR in Canada. All you need is to study well, listen & watch English conversations and follow your tutor’s advice ( if any). 

Interested in applying for a Work Permit to Canada? Check our current job openings & it’s IELTS requirements.

Cancellation Fee for IELTS?

More than five weeks before the test date, you may cancel your test application and receive a refund of less than a 25% administrative fee.

If you cancel your IELTS exam less than five weeks before the test date, you won’t receive a refund.

You won’t get a refund if you don’t take the test. Therefore, this is viewed as a cancellation as well.

Those who can provide a medical certificate five days following the test date are qualified for payment, less the local administrative cost.

IELTS Retake Exam Fee?

If you need to change your test day with at least five weeks to spare before the originally scheduled test date, you can ask for a test day transfer after deducting your cancellation/postponement cost. Ensure the new test date occurs no more than three months after the original.

Want to know the eligibility of your IELTS scores for your Visa? Book a free assessment to speak with our regulated consultants

BOOK NOW

We at AMK take great satisfaction in offering the best Immigration & Recruitment services to ensure that our clients have the most incredible experience when taking our immigration & recruitment services. 

The post Find out everything you need to know about the IELTS exam for Canada. appeared first on AMK Global Group.

item.title: Work in Canada as a Chef or Cook- A job in the Hospitality Industry may be what you’re looking for!
item.dc:creator: Alka bisht
item.category: Chef or Cook Jobs in Canada
item.description: The post Work in Canada as a Chef or Cook- A job in the Hospitality Industry may be what you’re looking for! appeared first on AMK Global Group.
item.content:encoded:
Being a multicultural country with people of varying backgrounds, the nation, and its citizens are open to various tastes, foods, flavors, and travel, which has grown the demand for skillful chefs & cooks from different countries with skills in multiple cuisines. YES, we are talking about CANADA and the job in the hospitality industry in the country.

In Canada, trained chefs and cooks have ample space to develop and enhance their skills in their field. Moreover, qualified chefs and cooks are immensely required across the hospitality industry at the moment to fulfill their labour shortage. In addition, restaurant chains and food cafés also welcome experienced cooks & chefs to maintain a smooth environment and meet customers’ expectations by providing delicious food and service, thus contributing to the country’s economy.

As a result, organizations looking for cooks and chefs employment in Canada with work permits seek the best and the most qualified applicants. In addition, many candidates choose a work visa for cooks in Canada because of the growing demand for Asian and Indian food cuisine in the country.

Why Chefs and Cooks will be in higher demand in Canada in 2022?

In the hospitality industry, having a job with a work permit appears to be vital to success and the possibility of establishing a bright future in Canada. WHY?

This is because the citizens and residents from various backgrounds love to explore meals and food delicacies from multiple places in the country. Therefore, chefs with experience are in high demand in the hospitality industry to serve individuals from various backgrounds, traditions, lifestyles, and cultures.

There is a high demand for chefs and cooks specializing in specific cuisines and food items. Likewise, talented bakeries with experienced bakers are well-received and placed in high-ranking positions. Chefs and cooks have plenty of opportunities in Canada, particularly in theme-based restaurants and food chains with locations in every major city and province.

Obtaining Permanent Residency and a Work Permit through the LMIA Dual Intent Program with AMK Global Group

Job Titles for Chefs & Cooks in Canada

  • Apprentice Cook
  • Journeyman/woman Cook
  • Executive Chef
  • Junior Chef
  • Deputy Chef
  • Head Chef
  • Station Chef
  • Corporate Chef
  • Dietary Cook
  • Pastry Chef
  • Specialist Chef
  • Master Chef

What Qualities Are Canadian Employers Looking for In Candidates Seeking Chef, Cook Work Permit Visas?

Pay close attention to the details- Throughout the whole cooking process, great attention to detail is essential. Failure to follow the kilograms, cooking temperatures, and other guidelines can lose control over the final dish. Therefore, the serving stage requires a high level of perfection.

A dedication to excellence- The chef’s most crucial responsibility is food quality. Everything needs commitment to excellence, from choosing the best ingredients to using them in the dish. Consequently, the chef’s responsibility is to serve the best quality to their customer, even if budget constraints prevent them.

Creativity- Chefs must follow all standards regarding presentation, taste, menu, and creativity on the plate. They’ll also need to think outside the box when designing the kitchen layout. In addition, sometimes customers come to a restaurant because of the chef’s inventive reputation and the creativity in his/her work.

Teamwork– People from many areas of life come together over a shared passion for food. So, excellent teamwork skills must help bind the team together with great enthusiasm. Like, it’s a plus if you can work and get along with your coworkers.

Leadership Qualities– Experienced chefs should lead their teams and get the most out of them. Thus they must be able to make orders and have them carried out promptly. Simultaneously, they must maintain a positive mood in the kitchen.

Organization- Working in a kitchen may be a highly hectic atmosphere; therefore, you must be able to keep maintain all times. In addition, during service, they may be required to mentor and coach junior staff members while ensuring that everything goes well.

Want to apply for jobs in the hospitality industry? We are hiring Chefs & Cooks for Canada. Reach out to us to speak with our regulated consultations.

Benefits of having a Work Permit for cooks and chefs in Canada

Canada has 4,575 cooks employed across many provinces, including Alberta, British Columbia, Ontario, Saskatchewan, Manitoba, and more.

  • According to recent news sources, career opportunities for chefs and cooks are predicted to expand by 2025, and both Cooks & Chefs will be in high demand, with around 52,000 to 55,000 job vacancies. 
  • It indicates that the hospitality and related sectors are experiencing increased demand for experienced chefs and cooks, particularly Indians.
  • In Canada, chefs and cooks receive various benefits, bonuses, and incentives. Therefore, getting a job in the hospitality industry is a plus as you will gain many other benefits.
  • The hospitality industry in Canada determines jobs based on relevant work experience, job titles, grades, education, and skill training.
  • Many fast food establishments and quick-service eateries provide flexible working hours.
  • Chefs and cooks specializing in specific cuisines and food items, such as Continental, Italian, Mexican, Pastries, and Baked goods, are also in high demand.
  • The number of theme restaurants and food chains in Canada is increasing, particularly in major cities and regions. Chefs and cooks are required to run a successful restaurant or food establishment.

Are you a skillful chef or cook with experience? Send us your resume today at info@amk.global to start your Canadian work journey. 

Canadian employers who hire qualified foreign workers through immigration programs also wish to hire them temporarily while IRCC processes their permanent residence application. As a result, employers can now apply for a dual-purpose Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA), which comes with a processing cost. These dual-purpose LMIAs can support a foreign national’s application for a Permanent Resident Visa and a Temporary Work Permit with IRCC.

So, grab the opportunity to get a work permit with your PR what’s best than an opportunity to settle in the world’s #1 country. It promises several benefits & a secure future for you & your family. 

At AMK Global, we ensure to offer the best immigration process. We understand our customer’s requirements and expectations. Therefore, our team always strives to provide the best immigration & recruitment services.

So if you want to get into the LMIA Dual Intent Program, CONTACT US now and get FREE Consultation to know more about jobs in the hospitality industry.

What are the requirements for COOKS & CHEFS to work in Canada?

Many candidates and immigration aspirants will be encouraged to apply for chef jobs in Canada with Work Permits in 2022. In addition, eligible individuals can use various immigration options for chefs and cooks. 

Furthermore, associating with a reputable immigration consultant, such as AMK Global Group, is the first step toward obtaining a chef or cook Work Permit in Canada. The skilled team of immigration consultants assists candidates in determining the best immigration path for them based on their academic credentials, skills, training, and experience to acquire a Canadian Work Permit for chefs and cooks and work and stay in the Canadian province of their choice.

Suppose interested individuals meet all eligibility criteria for cook and chef employment in Canada with Work Permits. In that case, they may be able to migrate to Canada as a chef or cook with a Work Permit. 

Eligibility requirements that you need to follow to get a job in the hospitality industry: 

  • Education – 12th grade (minimum).
  • Must have a Police clearance certificate.
  • Must have a job offer letter from any Canadian employer.
  • A Canadian employer should provide a copy of LMIA. 
  • Minimum a year of working experience in the respective occupation.
  • Minimum English language score of 5 bands in IELTS (language proficiency exams).
  • Adequate funds.

Currently, we are hiring Chefs & Cooks to place immediately. Check the below eligibility criteria & if you fit in, you can apply by sending your resume to info@amk.global 

Check out if you’re eligible to apply for a Chef or Cook job in Canada with AMK Global. CONTACT US NOW

List of documentation required for Canadian cook and chef jobs

To secure a Work Permit as a Cook and Chef, you need to follow a specific checklist of documents. Here, we have mentioned the set of documents required for a job in the hospitality industry.

  • Two years of relevant work experience.
  • The offer letter should be from a Canadian company that has received a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) and Social Development Canada (ESDC).
  • Secondary education (grades 10 and 12).
  • Speaking, Reading, Listening, and Writing are the IELTS modules that measure English proficiency. 
  • Canadian Language Benchmark (CLB) 5 – (Reading – 4 bands, Listening – 5 bands, Speaking – 5 bands, and Writing – 5 bands) is required for chefs and cooks obtaining work permits in Canada.
  • Medically fit.
  • Regional Passport Office Security Clearance Certificate
  • Sufficient funds

If you fulfill all eligibility criteria for the job in the hospitality industry, then book a free consultation from our regulated immigration Consultants. BOOK NOW.

Ways to Immigrate to Canada as a Chef & Cook

The economy has experienced significant improvements and growth through the programs like the Express Entry system and Provincial Nominee Programs that make it easier for skilled and semi-skilled workers to live and work in Canada.

You have a choice to choose from over 70 different immigration programs and visas as a skilled or semi-skilled worker. They provide you with a more significant opportunity to establish a new life overseas for yourself and your loved ones. However, the procedure can confuse many possibilities, especially if you aren’t sure which programs are appropriate for you and will assist you with your immigration and visa application.

Express Entry

The Express Entry system oversees Canada’s three federal economic immigration programs targeted toward qualified professionals seeking to reside and work in the country. It depends on the CRS (Comprehensive Ranking System), a point-based system that evaluates candidates based on age, language abilities, education, and work experience.

You must have a skill type 0 or a level A or B to be eligible for the Express Entry system. For example, chefs and cooks are categorized as level B, implying that they could be qualified to apply to any Express entry program. To participate in the Express Entry draw pool, you must create an online profile.

Provincial Nominee Program 

This immigration route allows foreign skilled or semi-skilled employees to work in Canada. Eligible candidates should have a valid job offer from a Canadian employer that LMIA supports to qualify for PNP. Kindly remember that each Canadian province has its PNP with in-demand occupation lists to meet the needs of industry and the labor market. Consequently, the PNP in-demand employment listings vary based on the demand for skilled labor in certain provinces. As a result, candidates should obtain assistance from a reputable immigration consultant, such as AMK Global Group, to know recent trends and developments.

Atlantic Immigration Pilot.

The Atlantic Immigration Program allows skilled foreign workers and international graduates of a Canadian university to work and live in one of four Atlantic provinces of Canada: New Brunswick, Nova Scotia, Prince Edward Island, or Newfoundland and Labrador. Employers can use the program to find competent individuals for roles they haven’t been able to fill locally.

Additionally, there are requirements such as work experience, job offers, language levels and educational qualifications, and obtaining enough settlement funds to immigrate to Canada. To be considered for this pilot, you must have at least one year of full-time, non-seasonal employment experience.

Ontario Immigrant Nominee Program (OINP)

The Ontario Immigrant Nominee Program is the province’s economic immigration program (OINP). Through Immigration, Refugees, and Citizenship Canada, it operates with the Canadian government (IRCC).

Foreign workers, international students, and anybody with the requisite abilities, experience, and education can submit nominations to the OINP.

The OINP seeks out and nominates permanent residents with the talents and competence that the Ontario economy requires. The Government of Canada makes the final decision on whether to approve the applications.

To apply for the jobs for chefs in Canada, Get a FREE online Consultation by an experienced and regulated consultant! BOOK NOW

How can AMK help you move to Canada?

Chefs and cooks have several opportunities in Canada. They should thus apply for a Canada Work Permit visa, which will allow them to work in Canada for a duration of time. However, we understand that you must be anxious about starting your application because opting for the Canadian immigration system may be a lengthy or time-consuming process with many forms, documents to complete, strict submission, and deadlines. 

But you know what, that’s why we’re here for. At AMK Global Group, we help reduce the stress and hassle of relocating internationally. Our Regulated Immigration Consultants are ready to assess your eligibility, check all documentation, and submit it on your behalf.

Seeking guidance from regulated consultants? BOOK a FREE consultation from AMK Global Group to get a hassle-free immigration process- CONTACT US

The post Work in Canada as a Chef or Cook- A job in the Hospitality Industry may be what you’re looking for! appeared first on AMK Global Group.

item.title: Medical Tests Requirements For Canadian Immigration in 2022!
item.dc:creator: Alka bisht
item.description: The post Medical Tests Requirements For Canadian Immigration in 2022! appeared first on AMK Global Group.
item.content:encoded:
Do you know, if you are planning to move to Canada, you will be required to undergo a medical test for Canadian immigration by a designated approved physician?

Whether you want to live in the country or visit the country temporarily, you will still be required to give a health exam before being issued a visa. Canada ensures to allow young skilled professionals who are fit and immensely contribute the knowledge and skills to the country’s economic growth.

Due to inappropriate health conditions, an individual may be considered medically inadmissible to Canada. Therefore, before visiting Canada, foreign individuals must overcome all such inadmissibility that can enable them to enter the country. Therefore, in this weekly blog, we are talking in depth about medical tests for Canadian Immigration. Keep Reading!

What are Medical tests required for Canadian immigration?

According to your age, you may be asked to undergo chest x-rays and laboratory tests at a clinic or a lab. It is a standard screening, and any abnormal results will be addressed with you by the doctor.

Based on your medical exam results, they may refer you to a specialist for additional testing. Additionally, to avoid delays in processing your medical examination, you must complete this request as soon as possible.

If a Government of Canada-approved COVID-19 vaccine is available, your panel physician may administer it to you. In addition, the panel physician will also note if you got the COVID-19 vaccine during your exam.

Consequently, you should also bring proof of vaccination to your appointment- either a physical copy or an electronic copy. Along with it, keep a copy of the vaccination record that the panel physician gave you.

Know everything about getting a work permit to Canada from India

Why is medical tests for Canadian immigration necessary?

An Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada (IRCC) panel of physicians examines applicants to determine whether they should be denied entry into Canada because of medical conditions.

In an IRCC-approved exam, your panel physician determines your health history, physical examination, and other tests. If your physician requires additional information about your health, they may refer you to a specialist for tests. In addition, you have the legal right to bring a supervisor to your appointment if you like.

Want to start your immigration process from Sri Lanka?? then, you should read this

Medical Test Requirements for Canada Permanent Resident

Depending on whether a person is asking for temporary residence (workers, students, and visitors) or permanent residence, some specific requirements must need to apply.

In addition, a health exam is not necessary for temporary residents choosing to stay for less than six months unless they plan to work in a specialized area. Such jobs comprise employment that needs to maintain public health, including frequent interaction with individuals. Below are some examples of such jobs:

  • Workers in child care programs.
  • Workers in primary and secondary schools.
  • Workers in health care settings.
  • Medical students.
  • Agriculturists from reputed or designated countries
  • Child care workers and teachers in elementary or secondary schools.
  • People who give children care at home.
  • Workers in the clinical laboratory.

But not limited to this, many other job titles also ask to take a medical exam for immigration before moving to Canada. Consequently, those agriculture workers who have already worked in certain countries for at least six months must undergo a health exam. Also, temporary residents who plan to stay only for a few months in Canada must undergo an exam to meet the criteria mentioned below.

  • You will be working in a field where you will be responsible for protecting the public’s health.
  • You are applying for the Super Visas of your parents and grandparents.

Book a free consultation to know more.

Validity of the Medical Test for Canadian Immigration?

For an individual who passes a medical exam for immigration outside Canada, the certificate will be applicable only for 12 months from the date of the assessment filed by a health officer or dedicated staff. However, there is no expiry date for the exam validity for admissible applicants.

 

 

How long will it take to process my application?

Medical exam reports take nearly four weeks to process if you’re applying as a temporary resident (visitor, student, or worker).

After receiving your results from the panel physician, it takes about three months to process your application as a permanent resident.

How long do the results of an IRCC medical examination remain valid?

The results of an IRCC medical exam are valid for 12 months from the date of the exam. If your findings are older than this, you will have to retake the exam.

Want to move to Canada? Book a free consultation to get access to the immigration process.

From immigration updates to the latest job vacancies, we make it easier for our customers to find the right match for their careers. Follow us on all our social media handles to get regular updates about immigration & recruitment services.

As professionals with decades of experience in Canadian immigration, our team is the best in the business to provide you with all the guidance you need. Book a consultation or email your query to info@amk.global

If you’re a Filipino and finding it difficult to start your immigration journey, this can help you

 

The post Medical Tests Requirements For Canadian Immigration in 2022! appeared first on AMK Global Group.

item.title: 5 reasons why Canada is the best place to study abroad!
item.dc:creator: Akshay Dalvi
item.description:
Students prefer to study abroad in Canada for a variety of reasons! While you already tumbled upon your interest in studying abroad in Canada, we’ll tell you the reasons why it is the best place to study abroad in 2022.   Here’s our top 5 list on Why Canada is the best place to study abroad! […]

The post 5 reasons why Canada is the best place to study abroad! appeared first on AMK Global Group.
item.content:encoded:
Students prefer to study abroad in Canada for a variety of reasons! While you already tumbled upon your interest in studying abroad in Canada, we’ll tell you the reasons why it is the best place to study abroad in 2022. 

 Here’s our top 5 list on Why Canada is the best place to study abroad!

1) World-class education in Canada 

You really can access amazing institutions highly ranked on the global rankings list. For example, the University of British Columbia, University of Toronto, and McGill consistently place in the top 20 universities in the world. The University of Saskatchewan is ranked first for water resources research, and Simon Fraser University ranks number one in Canada for innovation! In Canada, you’ll have small class sizes, hands-on learning opportunities, and co-op placements that allow you to work in your field before graduation, which gives you a significant leg up on your competition in terms of job readiness, competence, experience – and knowledge! This is a huge benefit to studying abroad in Canada and our #1 reason Canada is the best place to study abroad. 

2) Reasonably priced education!

We know studying abroad can be expensive. The US has some of the most expensive programs in the world, UK and Australia aren’t far behind. Fees & Costs are significant reasons while shortlisting a country when exploring the best places to study abroad. 

In Canada, education is reasonably priced!

Students and their families know this and take advantage of it. You can study for a 4-year degree at a Canadian equivalent “Ivy League-Esque school,” for a fraction of the cost of a US school. What a deal!

Thus Canada is the best place to study abroad because your studying abroad dream doesn’t need to break the bank. In Canada, you can make an affordable option. 

Looking for the best place to study abroad? Canada has everything you’re looking for. Besides, we have exciting programs for you to explore in Canada’s best universities. 
Book a free consultation with our Director of International Students, and reap the benefits of AMK Global’s free consultation. Book from here.

3) The people are friendly!

It is a known fact that the Canadian people are friendly and kind. You’ve seen unofficial polls everywhere, from magazines to Twitter, who survey a ton of people to determine how people

from different nations interact with others globally – and Canadians always come out on top as

the friendliest bunch! The truth is, Canadians exercise politeness, respect for others, and genuine kindness to help their neighbor. This can be considered excessive kindness to some or just an average day to a Canadian.

When a student leaves his home country what comforts & makes their life easy are the people they live with. Canada is ranked #1 in the world in terms of quality of living & which encourages every student looking for the best places to study abroad. Quality of life consists of various factors like culture, freedom, people & behavior. We have discussed the Canadian lifestyle in our previous blog. 

Learn more about what makes Canada the most friendly country & why it’s the best place to study abroad for you –

5 Things about Canada Tourism that will make you fall in love with the country. 

4) There is a ton to see and do!

There is always something AMAZING to see and do from coast to coast! Each province has something spectacular to offer students who study abroad. Check this out: BC has a bear

rainforest! In Alberta, you can explore the Rocky Mountains. Saskatchewan has dinosaur exhibits, and Manitoba has the Forks of the River! You can always plan to see the skydome, a

Broadway show or venture to Niagara Falls in Ontario, whale watching in Quebec, and seeing the Atlantic provinces’ gorgeous fall colors. The territories offer incredible northern lights and wildlife. Each city has its own vibe, tourist attractions, and nightlife. Seriously, there is

ALWAYS something to do.

What’s your academic life without some adventure, exploring & making memories in one of the world’s most beautiful destinations. Yes, it’s the best place to study abroad and the one that gives you a sweeping experience of living overseas—but also a happy academic life & of course gram-worthy photos. 

5) 4 seasons of fun!

Canadians really get out to explore the wild outdoors, and you should too! We know a quick walk around the block can do wonders for your mental health. You can really recharge with summer.

Swim in Lake Ontario, or a game of beach volleyball in Vancouver. You can take on the Cabot Trail in Nova Scotia for a great weekend hike! I personally love a wintery walk around Wascana Lake in Regina or exploring Banff National Park. We always encourage students to get out and explore the place they’re living. That means learning to love winter too! There are a ton of sports you can play to help pass the colder days with a smile on your face, like skating, snowboarding, tobogganing, and afterward, enjoying a cup of hot chocolate.

Have you explored Canada? Tell us where below and what you think makes Canada the best place to study abroad!

While Canada consistently ranks in the list of the best places to study abroad, there are various reasons a student should consider before choosing the country for their higher education. Studying abroad & studying in Canada is a dream for many, but at AMK Global, we are happy to be making it a truth for students. If you are confused with a pathway or have any questions, drop a comment below & our International Study Team will get back to you. 

If you are looking to study abroad & Canada is your first choice, our team of Regulated Canadian Immigration Consultants and study professionals will be happy to assist you at study@amk.global 

It all starts with your email. So wait no more & march on to the best place to study abroad – CANADA! Email us at study@amk.global 

‘Read More About Philippines Best Immigration Consultants

The post 5 reasons why Canada is the best place to study abroad! appeared first on AMK Global Group.

item.title: 7 Reasons- That will make you want to work in Canada
item.dc:creator: Alka bisht
item.description: The post 7 Reasons- That will make you want to work in Canada appeared first on AMK Global Group.
item.content:encoded:
Undoubtedly, Canada is the best place to work & study as it is known to offer High-quality education with globally recognized degrees.
To work in Canada, thousands of Canadian work visas are approved to the
skill level workers from across the globe. Canada offers various job opportunities in many exciting fields,
which eventually open the doors for all immigrants to work in Canada and live an excellent quality of life.
Not limited to this, Canada also has immense post-study work and immigration opportunities, which is
why Canada stands out as a popular country among students.
In addition, due to the vast job opportunities, many immigrants are more likely to prefer to work in
Canada with fair salaries. Canada welcomes hardworking individuals dedicated to their work and wants
to build their future excellently.
So if you are qualified and looking to work in Canada, most probably after reading this weekly blog, you
will surely want to work in Canada.
Let's get started with the reasons that will surely make you want to work in Canada.

Job Security in Canada

One of the crucial benefits you get while being employed in Canada is access to Employment Insurance (EI). Having access to employment insurance means you will get certain financial benefits if you lose your job. This is one of the standard benefits given to all the workers in Canada. In addition, you can get up to 35% of your average weekly earnings if you qualify for employment insurance (EI). However, suppose you lose your job, and there aren’t any jobs available. In that case, you will also be available to claim employment insurance benefits, but this may differ as per your occupation of the industry you are working with.

Get a free consultation from our experienced & regulated professionals. BOOK NOW

Paid Sick Leave

Do you know if you have to take sick leave in Canada and you will be covered financially as some companies provide their employee’s short-term disability finances? However, the government also offers a standard Employment Insurance sickness benefit to ensure your finances while on your sick leave. In addition, if you are unable to work for medical reasons, like injury, quarantine, illness, or other medical condition, you could claim sick benefit for up to 15 weeks and get a good percent of your salary.

Canada Pension Plan (CPP)

The Canada Pension Plan (CPP) includes that both employee and employer can contribute towards the pension scheme where the employees are entitled to. It is a standard work benefit that ensures an individual will get money over the retirement age of 60 once they retire from the company or organization.

This scheme is compulsory for all employees as it ensures saving plans for them with valid work visas. Usually, when a person retires, they often worry about money, so the Canada Pension Plan allowed having access to a portion of your earned income for the rest of your life as you have made it.

Want to work in Canada? Get in touch with our regulated immigration consultants.

Higher Salaries

Do you know what makes people from various sectors work in Canada?

Whether its hospitality sector or IT sector, Canada has substantial multinational companies and their headquarters & offices in Canada.

Due to the better working pattern with no stress employers are keen to work efficiently and effectively which help them to increase the number of their salaries. In the hospitality sector, we have many professionals in Canada to gain tremendous working experience and become PR.

Caregiving Benefits

Working in Canada also allow you to access family and caregiving benefit that will enable you to take care of your family members or your loved ones if they are injured or sick. Consequently, while working, you will also get Maternity and Paternity benefits that allow you to take time off if a woman is pregnant and want to spend time with the child after birth.

Under the Maternity benefits, new mothers can take anywhere from 17 to 50 weeks off leave from the designation position as per the employment history and number of hours. Despite this, temporary residents with a valid work permit in Canada can also be considered for parental benefits. In addition, maternity& paternity leave benefits also offer to leave for one or both parents as per Canada’s employment insurance plan. On top of this, pregnant women who recently gave birth or adopted a child can also get multiple benefits like Canada’s Prenatal Nutrition program.

To read more about– Beginners Guide to Work Permit in Canada.

Universal Healthcare Program

According to the Canada Universal Healthcare system, it ensures various Health Care benefits to individuals. Under this plan, all the citizens of Canada have received medical and doctor’s services. Whether you are a permanent resident or have a valid work visa in Canada, you can access free medical care covering all your prescription drugs paid through taxes.

On top of this, Canadian companies also offer affordable Healthcare plans to the employees to maintain overall health and well-being. In addition, the Healthcare system is well subsidized for a lifetime where every citizen of Canada can come and get themselves covered with the medical treatment irrespective of their job type or dependents.

Better Work-Life & Cost of Living

Canada offers a better cost of living and a work-life based on the area and provinces you live. Therefore, Canada is quite an affordable place for immigrants compared to other countries. However, as we know that there are undoubtedly other factors that need to be considered, including salaries, expenses, savings, etc.; thus, we eventually narrow down the choices. Here, a consultant work on your behalf to help you select the correct region as per your affordability. Despite this, Canada’s food, automobiles, and gas are very reasonable compared to other developed countries

Peaceful Environment

Above all, Canada is one of the safest and most friendly places to work, study, and live.  Canada offers excellent immigration and recruitment opportunities to encourage more skilled individuals to enhance their skills and knowledge and gain tremendous working experience to bolster the economy.

So, if you are looking to immigrate, you should first get in touch with the most trusted and regulated immigration consultant. They will assist you in applying for your work permit and thus provide you with a fast and hassle-free process in a more efficient manner.

For more information about the Work Permit and other related services, visit our website

The post 7 Reasons- That will make you want to work in Canada appeared first on AMK Global Group.

item.title: Top 6 Benefits of Hiring an Immigration Consultants or Lawyers
item.dc:creator: Alka bisht
item.description: The post Top 6 Benefits of Hiring an Immigration Consultants or Lawyers appeared first on AMK Global Group.
item.content:encoded:
TO BE AN EXPERT, LISTEN TO THE EXPERTS- Jenny Feraer

This precisely applies to the Canadian immigration process as well. So whether it’s about Canada Visa, PR process, Study Permit, Work Permit, and Business Visa, you will be required guidance from professionals who will assist you in every step to reach out to your dream destination.

Well, how many times you’ve tried on your own to achieve something, and on a first run, you will get success. This is hardly true, but we all require guidance or advice from professionals or experts at a certain point in our lives. 

I am sure you all will agree, from childhood to now, we need guidance at every turn, whether from professionals or an experienced person, so why not for the Immigration & Recruitment process? It will help you reach your dream destination and save valuable time that you can put into your other notable works.

From childhood till now, we need guidance at every turn, whether from teachers or parents.

Therefore, In this weekly blog, you will learn about the benefits of hiring a Consultant for your Immigration Process. 

Proper Guidance in Visa Selection

Every Immigration Consultant has a different visa category where you may be eligible for even more than one program at a time. So it may be pretty tricky for you to choose the best one per your requirements. Here, Regulated personnel is licensed by the Government to give you the proper guidance by selecting the best visa for your profile.

In addition, a PR consultant plays a significant role as they make you understand which visa programs work well for you as per your profile and its demand in the country. Consequently, they will also assist you in understanding your accurate score, which is a challenging and time-consuming process with the other free online assessment forms.

Get a free consultation from our experienced & regulated professionals.

Resolving Complex Issues with a better understanding

Often, most candidates get stuck during their educational credential assessment. However, it is not rocket science. Yes, getting help from an Immigration Consultant or lawyers saves a lot of your time as they can assist you in understanding the procedure correctly. Consequently, when complex issues like NOC are not correct or GCkey is revoked, a consultant helps you by providing the best possible solution.

Well-Prepared Application

Your application must be well presented and well-prepared to get a successful Canada visa, PR, and other services. Canadian authorities and Canadian employers will check every detail and review it thoroughly to check if you are eligible for the program or not. 

In addition, Immigration Consultants have a deep understanding of preparing visa applications more professionally. They will also suggest the improvement areas that will help you during your whole Canada Immigration process.

Learn more about Canadian Permanent Residency through Express Entry

Verified Documentation

Do you know that immigration & recruitment officers deeply research your documents and verify them? 

If they find any mismatched papers and details, they will quickly refuse you from going to Canada. However, if you try to verify your document alone, it will be a very time-consuming process. Here, a Canadian immigration Consultant assists in summing up all your documents before submission.

Up-to-Date Knowledge About Laws & Follow-Ups

An immigration Consultant or lawyer acts as a representative of your application on your behalf. They ensure that all the communication will go smoothly without any issues and interruptions. In addition, if any changes in immigration laws and procedures occur during your application process, they will keep you updated about the rules and even suggest an alternative option if required.

Communication with Higher Authorities 

The immigration process involves the government’s authority to deal with the documentation process properly. Usually, people are not familiar with such type of documentation along with migration functioning, which makes it difficult for them to communicate with the higher authorities. So, here consultants interact with the higher authorities on your behalf.

Want to know more? Contact us.

 

The post Top 6 Benefits of Hiring an Immigration Consultants or Lawyers appeared first on AMK Global Group.

item.title: Beginners Guide to applying for Canadian Permanent Residency through Express Entry
item.dc:creator: Sangita Maity
item.description:
Do you know Canada welcomes thousands of skilled workers each year through the Express Entry system? Express Entry is one of Canada’s most popular and fastest pathways to permanent residence. It is an online system that is used to manage immigration applications. So, if you are a beginner and confused about the various terms for […]

The post Beginners Guide to applying for Canadian Permanent Residency through Express Entry appeared first on AMK Global Group.
item.content:encoded:
Do you know Canada welcomes thousands of skilled workers each year through the Express Entry system?

Express Entry is one of Canada’s most popular and fastest pathways to permanent residence. It is an online system that is used to manage immigration applications. So, if you are a beginner and confused about the various terms for applying for Canadian Permanent Residency through Express entry, then you’re at the right place. 

Today’s blog has covered a detailed guide on applying for the Canadian Experience Class. So, don’t forget to read the whole blog till the end. Keep reading!

Before moving further, Let’s understand deeply what Express Entry Is?

What is Express Entry(EE)?

Express Entry is an online immigration application system that allows people to submit their profiles and be considered skilled immigrants. In addition, those candidates with the highest-ranking are asked to first apply for Express Entry to live and work in Canada.

Consequently, it is an electronic management application that assists an applicant in immigrating to Canada. The primary purpose of EE is to facilitate the selection and process of the Canadian economy immigration program under the Federal Skilled Worker Class, the Federal Skilled Trades Class, the CEC, and part of a Provincial Nominee Program. 

How does Express Entry work?

  • According to the point system, your application will be ranked if you fill out a profile.
  •  You would be asked to apply for a Permanent Residency in Canada as a skilled immigrant if you ranked highly.
  • Once you finalize the application procedure, it will process your application within the next six months.

Most probably, you must be wondering, how can you apply for Express Entry, Right? So, let’s have a look at that too.

How Can you apply for Express Entry (EE)?

Applying for Express entry is usually a two-step process wherein the first step you need to submit your profile which requires some important documents including;

  • Education Assessment Report
  • Language test results
  • Travel & Passport Documents

Once you submit your complete profile, you will receive an invitation to apply for Canadian PR. You also need to provide an actual application which includes your Additional Identity Document, Reference Letters, Results of a Medical Examination, and Police Clearance Certificate.

Get Online consultations from our professionals.

Eligibility for Express Entry?

Individuals with a university or a college degree, professional work experience, moderate proficiency in English or another language like French are ideal EE candidates. Consequently, an applicant must meet all the eligibility requirements to submit a profile to the express entry system. In addition, they also have to be eligible for one of the three federal programs, including:

  • Federal Skilled Worker (FSW)
  • Federal Skilled Trades (FST)
  • Canadian Experience Class (CEC)

Requirements for Express Entry 

There are some requirements that an applicant must follow to be eligible to apply as a skilled worker; therefore, an applicant:

  • Must be able to manifest a minimum score of 7 CLB or Canadian language benchmark on an approved language test.
  • Must have one year of continuous full-time work experience in the last ten years in the skilled occupation.
  • Have completed post-secondary education that is usually assisted against Canadian standards with an educational credential assessment.

Above, there are minimum requirements to apply to the Canadian Express Entry system as a skilled worker. However, an applicant must be required with a strong profile to be selected for further procedures.

Is a Job offer required for Express Entry (EE)?

You do not require any job offer for the EE system. However, most applicants selected for EE do not have any Canadian job offers. In addition, if you have a Canadian job offer, it can add up to 200 points to your CRS score.

Duration the Express Entry process takes?

The process of Express Entry can take at least six months, right from the submission of the profile to the issuance of a permanent resident visa. However, some processes might take a long time to be completed. In addition, If you do not receive an invitation to apply, then your Express Entry profile will be active in the pool of candidates for about 12 months. Later, after 12 months, you are supposed to resubmit your profile if you still haven’t received an invitation.

Want to know more? Contact us.

For Canadian Experience Class

Since the earliest time, the Canadian experience class or CEC has already offered significant pathways for the applicants who worked in Canada and transferred it to their permanent residence. As a result, the CEC is one of the very prominent options for temporary foreign workers and international graduates. 

Consequently, the CEC has grown in a big way into one of Canada’s most prominent immigration pathways for skilled workers. It is considered one of the overwhelming successes by communities, employers, and governments across Canada and immigration applicants.

What is the Canadian Experience Class program?

The Canadian experience class or CEC program is for candidates who have massive Canadian working experience, and now they are seeking permanent immigration to Canada. For the CEC, an applicant with excellent working experience can apply every three years to obtain your professional work experience and have legal status while working or studying in Canada. It is one of the fastest routes to Canadian permanent residence, and the process can take 3 to 4 months to process.

Eligibility for Canadian Experience Class program

You will be eligible for the Canadian experience class only if you meet the following requirements-

  • Applicants must have a year of skilled technical and professional working experience in Canada within 31 months of the application date.
  • For the Canadian experience class, you must meet the different language levels for your job, including- reading, writing, listening, and speaking.
  • Must have gained working experience working in Canada under temporary resident status with authorization.
  • They are already planning to work and live outside of the province of Quebec. 
  • Must meet Canadian language benchmark of 5 (CLB) for NOC B jobs and CLB 7 for skill level or A jobs.
  • At least one year of working experience defined massive hours of skilled workers in Canada and can obtain it through full-time or part-time work.

Applicants can also stay in Canada during the application process. Consequently, the Canadian experience class is open to individuals who are no longer in Canada. They can even submit significant applications within the three years of leaving the job.

The requirements for the Canadian experience class are usually based on the pass and fail model. If the minimum requirements are fulfilled, an applicant can enter the EE pool. However, if an application is not suitable for the Canadian Experience Class, then there may be a specific reason like if-

  • An applicant is working without authorization.
  • An applicant has gained working experience without temporary resident status in Canada.
  • An applicant is a refugee claimant in Canada. 

Click here to know more about the Canadian Experience Class.

How to calculate Canadian Experience Class CRS points?

You can use the CRS calculator tool to calculate  CRS points. Usually, the EE holds invitations and invites of CEC applications based on their CRS scores.

Is it required to have proof of funds for the Canadian Experience Class?

No, generally, proof of funds is not required for the CEC program, and you will also not be required to provide any documentation regarding your finances.

Can I apply to the CEC program from outside of Canada?

Unfortunately, yes. You can apply to the Canadian experience class program from outside of Canada as long as you meet all basic eligibility for the CEC mentioned above and use it from anywhere in the world.

Get online consultation from our experienced & regulated consultants.

What are the Residency Obligations that can arise?

Canada Residency application for permanent residents need a person to be present physically inside of Canada at least 730 days or to meet any of the following situations:

  • The person outside Canada is Employed on a full-time basis by a Canadian business or by the public service of Canada.
  • The person is an accompanying common-law partner, spouse, or child of a resident outside Canada and employed full-time by a Canadian business or a public service of Canada or a Canadian province.
  • If the person is outside of Canada accompanying a Canadian citizen who is their common-law partner, spouse, or if the person is a child, accompany their parent.

Suppose a person has had a Canadian PR for more than five years. In that case, the residency obligations will be calculated based on the five years before the date of an application received by a visa office.

Consequently, if a person has been a Canadian permanent resident for less than five years, they can be eligible to apply for a permanent residency card renewal for PRTD. 

To speak to our experts, contact us at info@amk.global.

The post Beginners Guide to applying for Canadian Permanent Residency through Express Entry appeared first on AMK Global Group.

item.title: Beginners Guide to Work Permit in Canada.
item.dc:creator: Alka bisht
item.category: how to apply for work permit
item.description: The post Beginners Guide to Work Permit in Canada.  appeared first on AMK Global Group.
item.content:encoded:
Do you know, working in Canada offers plenty of benefits? 

According to the Canadian labor laws, the employer in Canada follows specific rules and regulations to ensure the health and well-being of the employees. So, don’t you think that spending your significant time and effort can assist you in getting your successful work permit along with massive working benefits in Canada?

Therefore, in today’s blog, we are here to bring a beginner’s guide to get a successful work permit in Canada and enjoy working there, so don’t forget to read the blog till the end, as it can be beneficial for you if you are looking to gain a tremendous working experience in Canada.

What is a Work Permit (WP)?

It is a legal document permitted for foreign nationals to work inside Canada. As a result, Canada has become a prime destination for any foreign national looking for employment opportunities. According to the data, Canada issues about half a million WP to temporary foreign workers worldwide each year.

Who is eligible for Work Permit (WP)?

To apply for a WP candidate will be required a Canadian job offer supported by LMIA, Labour Market Impact Assessment. Those candidates who are qualified to apply for a WP also need to meet the following eligibility criteria-

  • Must have sufficient proof of funds to live in, support their family in Canada and return home.
  • Except the intent to live once they work for authorization expires.
  • Able to provide requested documents that prove their eligibility to enter Canada.
  • Do not have any criminal history or are medically inadmissible to Canada.

To know more, book a free consultation now.

How to apply for a Canadian Work Permit (WP)?

The application procedure differs depending on the WP you requested to apply for a Canadian WP. However, the first step is to determine the best WP that suits your eligibility and experience if you find it challenging to figure out the application for you.

How can I extend my Work Permit (WP)?

If you are planning to extend your WP, it is recommended to apply at least 30 days before the expiry date of your current permit. However, technically a candidate has the last day of expiry to apply for the extension request.

Contact us to learn more or book a free consultation

Can my family be included in my Work Permit application?

Well, if you are applying for an employer-supported WP, then only you may be eligible to include your spouse and dependent children accompanying you to Canada. However, if your children are school-aged and already living in Canada, they may benefit from attending a Canadian education institute without any separate study permit. In addition, your spouse may also be eligible to apply for an open WP to work anywhere in Canada.

Are documents required to apply for a Canadian Work Permit (WP)?

There are specific documents needed to apply for a Canadian WP, and it will depend on the type of WPyou want. However, applicants applying for a Canadian WP need to provide the following documents :

  • CV/ Resume
  • Complete application forms
  •  Proof of a family members status, if applicable
  •  A written offer of employment, if applicable
  •  Proof of payment for applicable government fees
  •  Medical exam results, if it is requested
  •  A valid copy of your passport
  •  Education credential’s copy
  •  Marriage certificate, if requested
  •  Labor market impact assessment (LMIA), if applicable
  •  Supportive evidence of financial terms to stay in Canada and return back to the home country.

Click here to start your work permit application

The medical exam for a Canadian Work Permit (WP)

Applicants need to complete a medical exam depending on their length of stay, where they have lived, and the occupation they will work in. If you plan to work in Canada for about less than six months, you will not be asked to give a medical exam with some exceptions. Also, if you plan to gain a working experience in Canada for longer than six months, you will be required to take a medical exam.

Furthermore, an applicant should complete the medical exam with the panel physician designated by IRCC. Applicants are also given the option to take an upfront medical exam which usually includes contacting the panel physician directly and taking the prior exam to submit aWP application. Additionally, if you do not provide your medical exam results with your application then, the IRCC officers will send you the instruction on the process to complete the medical exam, and they will also provide you with a specific deadline to complete the medical exam.

Learn more about the difference between Canada PR & Canada Citizenship

Can my Work Permit application be refused?

Yes, your WP application can be refused, and there are many reasons. However, if it is unclear to you why your application was denied, you can apply for GCMS notes as it can assist you in getting a better idea and helping you to address the officer’s concern if you decide to re-apply. 

Below are some of the common reasons that your WP could refuse.

  • You do not meet the whole eligibility criteria for the WP you are applying for.
  • The officers were not convinced about your application that, at the end of your authorized stay in Canada, you would return to your home country.
  • The officer was not convinced that you could perform your intended work well.

How Can AMK Global Help?

Being one of the most trusted regulated & immigration firms for various services in Canada & the UK. Our professionals provide the best consultations on your PR, Work Permit, PGWP, Canadian Experience Class, and many more. 

AMK Global expert offers a deep understanding to their employees about their concern services. As a result, we have serviced many job seekers and professionals to reach their dream destination.

Contact us, and our professional team will assist you with the best consultation.

The post Beginners Guide to Work Permit in Canada.  appeared first on AMK Global Group.
